meanings.definition: A high body temperature, typically accompanied by shivering and sweating.
meanings.sent1: During the flu season, many people experience fever as a sign of illness.
meanings.sent2: The doctor measured the child's fever with a thermometer.
meanings.sent3: The fever of excitement spread through the crowd as the concert began.
meanings.sent4: The fever of anticipation for the new movie release was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The fever of competition drove the athletes to give their best performance.

meanings.definition: A state of excitement or agitation.
meanings.sent1: The fever of the party was contagious, making everyone dance and laugh.
meanings.sent2: She felt a fever of joy when she received the good news.
meanings.sent3: The fever of impatience made him check his watch every few minutes.
meanings.sent4: The fever of curiosity burned within her, urging her to explore the unknown.
meanings.sent5: The fever of creativity inspired the artist to paint late into the night.
